quizzes.question_text:
Use the fraction bar to complete the sentences below.

The fraction bar has _ equal parts.
Each part is _ of the whole.
solution: Look at the fraction bar and count how many equal parts it has.
The fraction bar is divided into 3 equal parts.
When something is divided into 3 equal parts, each part is 1 of the 3. We call this one-third and write it as $\frac{1}{3}$.
Therefore, the fraction bar has 3 equal parts and each part is $\frac{1}{3}$ of the whole.
solution_image_tag: Three empty rectangular boxes arranged horizontally, outlined in blue. The boxes appear to be placeholders for answers or values to be filled in.
quizzes.backend_description: Three equal-sized empty rectangles arranged horizontally in a row. Each rectangle has a blue border and white interior, likely intended for students to draw or write in as part of a mathematical exercise.

quizzes.question_text:
Use the fraction bar to complete the sentences below.

The fraction bar has _ equal parts.
3 parts are shaded.
Each part is _ of the whole.
The shaded portion shows _.
solution: Look at the fraction bar and count how many equal parts it has.
The fraction bar is divided into 4 equal parts.
When something is divided into 4 equal parts, each part is 1 of the 4. We call this one-fourth and write it as $\frac{1}{4}$.
Therefore, the fraction bar has 4 equal parts and each part is $\frac{1}{4}$ of the whole.
Since 3 parts are shaded out of 4 total parts, the shaded portion represents $\frac{3}{4}$.
solution_image_tag: A fraction bar divided into 4 equal rectangular sections arranged horizontally. 3 sections are shaded in blue, while the remaining section is white. Each section has a blue border.
quizzes.backend_description: A fraction bar divided into 4 equal rectangular sections arranged horizontally. 3 sections are shaded in blue, while the remaining section is white. Each section has a blue border.

The fraction bar is divided into 7 equal parts.
When something is divided into 7 equal parts, each part is 1 of the 7. We call this one-seventh and write it as $\frac{1}{7}$.
Therefore, the fraction bar has 7 equal parts and each part is $\frac{1}{7}$ of the whole.
Since 3 parts are shaded out of 7 total parts, the shaded portion represents $\frac{3}{7}$.
